text: thumb| Hirundo rustica The barn swallow (Hirundo rustica) is the most widespread species of swallow. It can be found worldwide. This distinctive passerine bird has blue upperparts, a long, deeply forked tail and curved, pointed wings. It lives everywhere except Australia. The bird is becoming less common in Europe.http://sabap2.adu.org.za/docs/sabap1/518.pdf == References == Category:Passeri Category:National symbols of Austria Category:National symbols of Estonia
title: Barn swallow
